title: Kebaya with Red Peonies

  object_colour: multicolored

  physical_appearance: This is a beige kebaya top. It has elongated tapered ends
 and is embroided with peony and foliage motifs concentrated towards the bottom. The ends of the sleeves are also embroided with peony and foliage motifs.

  subject_terms_1: tops (garments
 general) flowers (motifs) Peranakan blouses (main garments) foliage (motif) folk costume

  subject_terms_2: Blouses Motifs Ethnic costume Peranakan (Asian people)

  subject_terms_3: Peranakan costumes

  sgcool_label_text: This kebaya is embroidered with peony and foliage motifs against a gingham fabric with white flecks. Kebayas with elongated tapered ends were popular in the 1930s and many were commissioned by Peranakan women. It is part of a donation which contains a mixture of garments worn by Peranakan men and women.
